page.title: 18FARMING AROUND GLAMIS
page.content:
As with the topography , the farming around Glamis can be divided into two types.
1) The rich farmlands, worked in large holdings, in the Strath. This is intensively managed, growing grass for grazing and for hay and silage, winter and spring sown barley, wheat, potatoes, some peas, and recently oil seed rape. The rape crop in spring adds a striking new colour to the landscape. The main stock is imported breeds of cattle - mainly Limousin and Charolais - kept for both breeding and fattening, and some of these are prize winning animals at local and national shows. This land is worked by farm labourers. It gives the impression that there are no poor farmers.
